name: Participant
title: participant
description: Logical Model: A pattern followed by resources that represent the participant in some activity, process, or responsible for providing information about a resource.

element.definition: A pattern followed by resources that represent the participant in some activity, process, or responsible for providing information about a resource.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Business identifiers assigned to this participant by one of the applications involved.  These identifiers remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.
element.comment: Note: This is a business identifier, not a resource identifier (see [discussion](resource.html#identifiers)).  It is best practice for the identifier to only appear on a single resource instance, however business practices may occasionally dictate that multiple resource instances with the same identifier can exist - possibly even with different resource types.  For example, multiple Patient and a Person resource instance might share the same social insurance number.
element.requirements: Allows identification of the participant as it is known by various participating systems and in a way that remains consistent across servers.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Whether the participant is currently active
element.definition: Whether this participant record is in active use.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Description of participant as presented to a consumer while searching.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
